citation.article-title: Caldimonas manganoxidans gen. nov., sp. nov., a poly(3-hydroxybutyrate)-degrading, manganese-oxidizing thermophile.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Caldimonas (Cal.di.mo'nas. L. adj. caldus hot; Gr. fem. n. monas unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Caldimonas hot (heat-loving) monad)
Cells are motile by means of a single polar flagellum, especially during the early stages of culture without shaking.
Neither sheath formation nor filamentous growth is observed.
Optimum growth temperature and pH are 50 °C and 8-9, respectively.
Many organic acids and carbohydrates are utilized.
PHB granules are accumulated as storage material.
The G+C content of the DNA is around 66 mol%and ubiquinone-8 is the major quinone.
The type species of the genus is Caldimonas manganoxidans.
